text: children consumed more fresh green vegetables, especially in the first half of the year, although most reduced their consumption of other vegetables. Purchases of quick-frozen peas and beans generally increased, but extremely wide group differences four or more children to 0.9 oz. per head in younger two-adult households; average consumption by older couples and other wholly-adult households was 0.5 oz. per head per week.
